Class AnnotationJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor.AnnotationJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AnnotationJPanel
extends ActiveJPanel

This class is used by the AnnotationOverlay to create an arrow from the region of interest to the annotation.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AnnotationJPanel

public AnnotationJPanel()
Constructor adds listeners to this AnnotationJPanel and allows for keyboard focus. All boolean values are set to false.

Method Detail

set_cursor

public void set_cursor(java.awt.Point current)
Move the rubber band line cursor to the specified pixel point. If the rubber band line was not previously started, this will specifiy the initial point for the line. If the rubber band line was previously started, this will specify a new location for the ending point of the line.

Parameters:
current - The point where the rubber band line should be drawn

stop_cursor

public void stop_cursor(java.awt.Point current)
Stop the rubber band line cursor and set the current position to the specifed pixel coordinate point.

Parameters:
current - the point to record as the current point, in pixel coordinates

getLineCursor

public LineCursor getLineCursor()
Method used by annotation overlay to get the region selected by the line cursor.

Returns:
cursor

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
